<div class="paper-header">
# Deep Intersections: Cross-Modal Neural Networks & Execution Contexts
<div class="author-block">Charaf Eddine</div>
<div class="institution-block">Arkiom Research Lab</div>
</div>

<div class="abstract-section">
**Abstract.** This research log documents the exploration of intersections between small language models, context-orchestration, and execution graphs. We propose a novel framework for cross-modality reasoning.
<br><br>
**Keywords:** *Cross-Modality, Execution Graphs, Context-Orchestration, SLMs*
</div>

<figure class="architecture-figure paper-figure-wide">
  <img src="assets/images/classy-architecture.png" alt="Deep Intersections Architecture">
  <figcaption><strong>Figure 1:</strong> High-level schematic of the Cross-Modal Context Orchestration framework. The <em>Language Model</em> (left) encodes multimodal inputs into a unified representation, which acts as the state space for the <em>Context Orchestrator</em> (center). This orchestrator dynamically navigates an <em>Execution Graph</em> (right), delegating sub-tasks to external <em>Data Stores</em> and <em>Function Primitives</em>.</figcaption>
